meanings.definition: to rope or catch with a lariat
meanings.sent1: The cowboy was lariating the runaway calf with skill.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys lariating horses during the rodeo.
meanings.sent3: The dog was lariating the ball, thinking it was a clever game.
meanings.sent4: Her words lariated his heart, pulling him closer.
meanings.sent5: The lariating technique he used was swift and effective.

meanings.definition: pertaining to or characteristic of a lariat
meanings.sent1: The lariating rope was made of strong fibers.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy's hat had a lariating design on the brim.
meanings.sent3: The lariating sound of the rope hitting the ground was soothing.
meanings.sent4: Her lariating skills were admired by all in the rodeo.
meanings.sent5: The lariating tradition was passed down through generations.
